interface SecondaryAnimationSpring {

    center?: number;

Properties

Optionalbones

bones?: number[]

Specify the node index of the root bone of the swaying object.

  • Defined in SecondaryAnimationSpring.d.ts:45

Optionalcenter

center?: number

The reference point of a swaying object can be set at any location except the origin. When implementing UI moving with warp, the parent node to move with warp can be specified if you don't want to make the object swaying with warp movement.

  • Defined in SecondaryAnimationSpring.d.ts:35

OptionalcolliderGroups

colliderGroups?: number[]

Specify the index of the collider group for collisions with swaying objects.

  • Defined in SecondaryAnimationSpring.d.ts:50

Optionalcomment

comment?: string

Annotation comment

  • Defined in SecondaryAnimationSpring.d.ts:7

OptionaldragForce

dragForce?: number

The resistance (deceleration) of automatic animation.

  • Defined in SecondaryAnimationSpring.d.ts:28

OptionalgravityDir

gravityDir?: Vector3

The direction of gravity. Set (0, -1, 0) for simulating the gravity. Set (1, 0, 0) for simulating the wind.

  • Defined in SecondaryAnimationSpring.d.ts:23

OptionalgravityPower

gravityPower?: number

The strength of gravity.

  • Defined in SecondaryAnimationSpring.d.ts:17

OptionalhitRadius

hitRadius?: number

The radius of the sphere used for the collision detection with colliders.

  • Defined in SecondaryAnimationSpring.d.ts:40

Optionalstiffiness

stiffiness?: number

The resilience of the swaying object (the power of returning to the initial pose).

  • Defined in SecondaryAnimationSpring.d.ts:12
